body.name: Noctua NF-A8 PWM, Premium Quiet Fan, 4-Pin (80mm, Brown)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
features: Premium quiet fan, 80x80x25 mm, 12V, 4-pin PWM, max. 2200 RPM, max. 17.7 dB(A), >150,000 h MTTF
Award-winning 80x25mm A-series fan with Flow Acceleration Channels and Advanced Acoustic Optimisation frame for superior quiet cooling performance
8cm format is ideal for compact PC cases (HTPC, ITX, Small Form Factor) and other chassis (intake & exhaust), replacement fan for NAS and other devices, etc.
4-pin PWM version for automatic speed control via 4-pin PWM fan headers, broad 450-2200rpm speed range (1750rpm max. with supplied Low-Noise Adaptor)
Includes anti-vibration mounts, fan screws, Low-Noise Adaptor, extension cable and y-cable for running two PWM fans on the same header

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.9 4.9 out of 5 stars 1,885 ratings 4.9 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The NF-A8 is a highly optimised, premium quality quiet 80mm fan. Featuring Noctua’s AAO (Advanced Acoustic Optimisation) frame as well as sophisticated aerodynamic design measures such as Flow Acceleration Channels, the NF-A8 further improves the renowned quiet cooling performance of the award-winning NF-R8. The PWM version sports Noctua’s custom designed NE-FD1 IC for fully automatic speed control via 4-pin fan headers and comes with a Low-Noise-Adaptor to reduce the maximum speed during PWM control from 2200 to 1750rpm. Its superb running smoothness, reference-class SSO2 bearing and Noctua’s trusted premium quality make it an elite choice for the highest demands.

AAO frame Noctua's AAO (Advanced Acoustic Optimisation) frames feature integrated anti-vibration pads as well as Noctua's proprietary Stepped Inlet Design and Inner Surface Microstructures, both of which further refine the fan's performance/noise efficiency.

Flow Acceleration Channels The NF-A8 impeller features suction side Flow Acceleration Channels. By speeding up the airflow at the crucial outer blade regions, this measure reduces suction side flow separation and thus leads to better efficiency and lower vortex noise. SSO2 bearing The NF-A8 features the further optimised second generation of Noctua's renowned, time-tested SSO bearing. With SSO2, the rear magnet is placed closer to the axis to provide even better stabilisation, precision and durability. Integrated anti-vibration pads Integrated anti-vibration pads made from extra-soft silicone minimise the transmission of minute vibrations while maintaining full compatibility with all standard screws and other mounting systems. Scope of delivery Low-Noise Adaptor (L.N.A)NA-YC1 4-pin PWM y-cableNA-EC1 30cm extension cable4x NA-AV1 anti-vibration mountsFan screws

Inner Surface Microstructures With the tips of the fan blades ploughing through the boundary layer created by the Inner Surface Microstructures, flow separation from the suction side of the blades is significantly suppressed, which results in reduced blade passing noise and improved airflow and pressure efficiency.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth paying little more for quality plus extra parts
reviews.reviewText: This fan cost a little more than some other brands but you can tell is very high quality part. Also it included an extension cable, a “Y” splitter cable, and a cable that lowers fan speed if running of uncontrolled header, all of which would cost extra if not included. My mother board only has one fan header for the CPU, with this I was able to use the splitter and run both cpu cooler fan and case fan off one header. A bonus of doing it this way is that the case fan is speed controlled by the cpu temperature so runs quiet or turns off when not needed and spins up when computer gets hot. No wasted money for RGB lights only whats needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Saved my ancient Windows 98 Box
reviews.reviewText: This fan is totally overkill for my Gateway 1GHz Pentium III I use for old games, but it's certainly much quieter than that 25yr old fan that was attached by gateway at the factory.Very quiet, great airflow.. 100% recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Noctua are the best computer fans ever
reviews.reviewText: All Noctua fans are quiet, efficient and long lasting. We install only Noctuas in 2U rack mount computers used to manage Audio Visual shows. We run I7 -11 CPUs with 4 Noctua 80mms and a Noctua CPU cooler. Processer temps run 50 to 60C, case temps stay below 40C. Noctuas are silently running 8 hours a night with no issues. They come with cords, screws, rubber mounts in a great package.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I used this to replace a CPU fan in my Lenovo M91p SFF computer.The rubber corners are a nice touch to further reduce noise/vibration. I had to remove the upper corners (with fan lying flat) as there is a shroud which goes over the fan holding it in place and it would not fit with the top rubber corners.The fan is silent and moves a good amount of air. I've used Noctua products in the past and have always been happy with them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits in front panel of Dell Optiplex SFF PC
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to put in a Dell Optiplex 7060 and it fits perfectly in the front panel slot. It comes with everything you need except a screwdriver. It's very quiet and I've been using this brand for years and never had one fail or start rattling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It comes with plenty of adapters and extensions to plug it in, and the fan is very quiet/silent when running.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The classic for a reason
reviews.reviewText: Works great - Noctua are a classic for a reason. This is a swap-in replacement for an HPE ML30 Gen10 Plus CPU cooler fan. You need to remove the rubber isolators from the fan body, but once you do that there is enough thread length on the stock screws to swap this fan in place of the stock fan. Same rated CFM without the low-noise adapter installed, and FAR quieter. Unlike the other fans in the ML30, the CPU fan is a standard 4-pin PWM header.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Unit comes with multiple methods of installing and has multiple cords/adapters to help you do so. It’s also so quiet that I am now annoyed by my other fans that weren’t replaced since those are no longer the quiet ones.
